example.eg: Eat what you can and I'll have the rest.
example.egtrans: 你能吃什么就吃什么，剩下的归我。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 剩余, 剩下, 留下

example.eg: You can't work all the time; some rest is essential if you want to stay healthy.
example.egtrans: 我今晚要在家呆着，好在晚会前休息一会儿。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 放松, 休息, 歇息

example.eg: Seven hours' rest is the minimum I can function on.
example.egtrans: 我昨晚上睡了七个小时。

example.eg: Yes, please take the children out of the house. I could use the rest.
example.egtrans: 对，请把孩子们带到外面去，让我安静会儿。

trans_examp.trans_cn: 安静, 宁静, 宁静

example.eg: The car accelerates quickly from rest.
example.egtrans: 这辆车从静止很快加速起来。

example.eg: I rested today instead of going out.
example.egtrans: 我今天休息了，没出去。

example.eg: Can we rest for a while or do we need to keep walking?
example.egtrans: 我们能歇会儿吗？还是得接着走？

trans_examp.trans_cn: 休息, 歇息, 暂歇

example.eg: You can tell that the week's rest at the beach has benefited you.
example.egtrans: 看来那一整周的海边假期让你受益颇多。

example.eg: We have time for three hours' rest before the party.
example.egtrans: 派对前，我们有3小时的休息时间。

example.eg: When driving, a rest every two hours is recommended.
example.egtrans: 驾驶时，每两小时的一次间歇是很有必要的。

example.eg: There's half a note's rest before the chorus comes in.
example.egtrans: 合唱开始前，有半个音符的停顿。

example.eg: Place the rest in the middle of the staff.
example.egtrans: 请将休止符放在五线谱的中间。

example.eg: Please bring the foot-rest over here so I can put my feet up.
example.egtrans: 请将垫脚台拿过来，好让我放脚上去了。

trans_examp.trans_cn: （为身体某部位提供休息的）支撑物, （搁放东西的）台、垫、架

example.eg: They stopped at a pub and guesthouse called the Traveller's Rest.
example.egtrans: 他们在一家名为“旅者休息处”的酒馆兼宾馆停了下来。

example.eg: Yes, I'm awake. I'm just resting here, not sleeping.
example.egtrans: 是的，我醒着。我只是躺着而已，没在睡觉。

example.eg: The ball rested at the bottom of the hill.
example.egtrans: 球滚到山脚就不动了。

example.eg: I rested for seven hours last night.
example.egtrans: 我昨晚睡了7小时。

dsense.name: rest
dsense.guideword: (remain, be) (短语 rest assured (that)：尽管放心)

example.eg: Rest assured that I'll be there.
example.egtrans: 尽管放心，我会去的。

example.eg: We should let the matter rest there.
example.egtrans: 我们应该让这个问题到此为止。

example.eg: His parents are resting at the Oak Hill Cemetery.
example.egtrans: 他的双亲长眠于橡树山公墓。

example.eg: The decision rests with you.
The prosecution rested its case after it felt that it had presented all the evidence.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 停止（对案件等提出新的证据）

example.eg: Let's rest the horses before tomorrow's long ride.
Rest the statue carefully on its stand.
The whole deal rests on your ability to keep your promises.
After climbing that mountain, I had to rest up for three days!  After his accident, he needed a few days to rest up and regain his strength.
You need to rethink your argument, as it presently rests upon a very flimsy premise.

dsense.name: and all the rest of it

example.eg: For Christmas dinner we had roast turkey, Brussels sprouts, and all the rest of it.
Elaine wants to be a rich woman living in a mansion with servants, a swimming pool, and the rest.
example.egtrans: 伊莱恩希望成为一名贵妇，住在别墅中，配备仆人和泳池等。

example.eg: I met your mum in a bar, and the rest is history!
While the man was at rest, researchers measured his brain activity.
The truck was at rest when the accident occurred.
The doctor recommended bed rest and plenty of fluids to aid his recovery.
Sabbath is for Jews a day of rest.
Today he had a day of rest from work.
The priest said a prayer for the deceased's eternal rest at the gravesite.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 永恒的休息, 喻指死亡

example.eg: So, you agree with me? Then I rest my case.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 我的话讲完了，无需多说

example.eg: She was laid to rest under the oak tree next to her husband.
The politician wanted to lay the rumours about his private life to rest.

dsense.name: put [sb]'s mind at rest, set [sb]'s mind at rest, set [sb]'s heart at rest

example.eg: Let me just put your mind at rest: your condition is completely treatable.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 使消除疑虑, 使安心, 放心

example.eg: The law states that employees must be allowed to take rest breaks.
Jim had to move into a rest home because he couldn't cope on his own any more.
My late father – rest in peace – would have known what to do in these circumstances.

dsense.name: rest on your laurels, rest on your oars

example.eg: Your mark of 80% was very good, but the next test's harder so don't rest on your laurels.

trans_examp.trans_cn: 满足于现有成绩, 自我满足

example.eg: This restaurant has very unusual restrooms.
We took a rest stop after the first 300 miles.  I really need a rest stop; can you pull over in the next layby?

dsense.name: rest stop, rest area
dsense.guideword: US (lay-by: area for vehicles to pull over)

example.eg: Yesterday we carried Grandma to her final resting place.
My favourite resting place is my conservatory.
You can't just stop and take a rest when you're running a marathon!
